entry.title: Traditou
entry.content:
Traditou has been submitted on the Chrome Web Store, pending approval.

Traditou intercepts the original subtitle files sent from the website servers, parses them and displays the original subtitles along with English subtitles on the bottom, with Google translate.

This extension can be used with the trifecta of French Canadian streaming websites: Tou.tv, Noovo.ca, and TeleQuebec, with the goal of French language learning in mind.

Traditou not only matches words closely, it also transforms TV-style rolling captions (which are visually difficult to follow) into more readable streaming service style subtitles.

Tools

  • Frontend: JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Backend: NodeJS
  • CI/CD: Chrome Extension API

Traditou was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on February 07, 2023.

entry.title: Calligrapher
entry.content:
Calligrapher is a web app that aids the Chinese language learning by generating character PDF worksheets.

Try it at chinesecalligrapher.com.

The idea of the tool was formulated to encourage my boyfriend to learn Mandarin after he binge-watched a Chinese drama.

Calligrapher generates printer and tablet-friendly PDF worksheets to aid writing Chinese characters much like the worksheets that I used in elementary school. However, instead of having only traceable characters, Calligrapher gives customizable lexical context.

With Calligrapher, your worksheets are labelled with pronunciations, radicals, stroke orders, as well as individual character and full text translations. There are also different fonts to choose from, providing advanced Chinese learners with a template to improve cursive Chinese calligraphy.

More features are currently in the making. To accomodate the spaced repetition learning technique, flashcards with animated stroke orders and voice pronunciations as well as quizzes based on past user text input will soon be available.

Tools

  • Frontend: JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Backend: NodeJS, Express and EJS
  • APIs for getting character information: Google Cloud Tranlation API and Hanzi
  • CI/CD: Digital Ocean and GitHub Actions

Calligrapher was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on April 18, 2021.

entry.title: Dependency Viewer
entry.content:
Dependency Viewer presents application dependency information in graphs.

Table of Contents

  • Introduction
  • Features
  • Tools

Introduction

Dependency Viewer dynamically obtains app lists from Prometheus. Then, each app’s dependency information is fetched from the apps’ Spring Boot endpoints.

It greatly simplifies debugging production issues that are spanned across multiple applications and also familiarizes developers with app dependency relationships.

Note: Dependency Viewer is a project that I created during my internship at the Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan. Sensitive company information has been changed or blurred out and graph generations have been sped up.

Features

Main Tool Bar

Select an app to generate a graph: By selecting an app type (UI, API, or core), an environment (dev, stg, or prd), and an app name, you can generate a dependency graph.

Favourite an app: Click on the hollow green star to save an app to favourites. You can access your favourite apps within advanced options (more on this later).

Graph

Hover to show more: Hover over nodes to see how this app is connected to other apps, and this app’s environment and version information.

Click on nodes to show a pop-up app panel: Looking for more information on this app? Click to expand the pop-up app panel. More on this below.

Extra tools panel

Select a layout: Choose between different layouts to optimize node placement.

Highlight a keyword: Also in the extra tools panel, you can highlight a keyword to quickly filter through apps.

Select a view: You can toggle between colour-coding app statuses (green for up and red for down) and environments (light blue for development, medium blue for staging, dark blue for production).

Show circular dependencies:

  • A. Highlight different instances of the same apps (e.g., different versions of an app exist in the graph)

  • B. Highlight same instances of the same apps (e.g., the edges within a circular loop of “app1 → app2 → app3 → app1”).

Collapse duplicate apps: Collapse apps that have the same name / url but different versions to show a more concise graph. This is to priorize the understanding of app relationships.

Show more information: Click on the ⓘ icon or alternatively press ‘?’ on the keyboard to see a guide to reading a graph.

App Panel

View info link: Open the app’s information link in a new tab.

View sub-dependencies: See a graph of a chosen app’s sub-dependencies in a new tab.

Advanced Options

Under ⚙️ tab

Clear cache: To get realtime app lists (for example, a new app is deployed), you can click the Clear Cache button to refresh the cached app lists.

Enter custom URL: In the case when you can’t find an app, you can enter your own URL.

Manage favourite apps: Use the dropdowns to add or remove favourite apps, and you can generate graphs from there. The graphs will be presented in a new tab.

Tools

  • Frontend: StencilJS (JavaScript, HTML, and CSS)
  • Graph library: Cytoscape
  • Backend: NodeJS and Express)
  • CI/CD: Bamboo and Pivotal Cloud Foundry]
  • Testing: Jest

Dependency Viewer was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on March 18, 2021.

entry.title: Big Fuss
entry.content:
With React Native and Spring Boot, I wrote a party trivia mobile (iOS and Android compatible) app that will display user submitted questions.

See the code here.

Big Fuss was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on May 30, 2020.

entry.title: Poet
entry.content:
Poet is a lightweight Chrome extension that displays a new poem every day upon new tab launches.

Install Poet from the Chrome extension web store.

Displays a new poem every day.


Add poems to your favourites.


View and manage your saved poems.


Refresh for a new poem.

Tools:

  • User Interface: JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
  • Chrome API: Service Worker to make REST calls and localStorage to store users’ daily poem and favourite poems.

Check out the source code on my GitHub.

Poet was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on May 20, 2020.
